thread.title: ISPAS Wins Contract to Deliver an Advanced Radar System to the Johan Sverdrup Oil Field
thread.title_full: ISPAS Wins Contract to Deliver an Advanced Radar System to the Johan Sverdrup Oil Field

title: ISPAS Wins Contract to Deliver an Advanced Radar System to the Johan Sverdrup Oil Field
text:
ISPAS Wins Contract to Deliver an Advanced Radar System to the Johan Sverdrup Oil Field Monday, September 21, 2015 by ISPAS Print Email 
Statoil and Norwegian radar company ISPAS AS have signed contract for the installation of a new, advanced oil spill detection (OSD) radar system for the Johan Sverdrup field. 
The new-generation OSD radar will be the first operational system to detect oil spill at sea within a wide range of weather conditions, including quiet and coarse sea states, regardless of visibility and light. 
According to ISPAS, the contract is a breakthrough for the advanced radar system for environmental monitoring. 
A video presentation of the new radar system can be viewed at the company's YouTube channel. 
For more information, please contact ISPAS AS CEO Richard Norland on +47 922 52612. Follow Us:
